content.raw:
@{557058:53a1879d-b572-46c9-97d3-8fa52b2ff8a7} , I think this tutorial needs more work.

The user should be instructed from the beginning to start from the `gzweb` repository clone, otherwise the `../gz3d/build/gz3d.js` doesn't lead anywhere. And if they're starting from the source, then they might as well use the example from there instead of creating a new file.

I also think that the code explanation could give the user a bit more context.

So I'll decline this pull request for now. We'll be migrating this repository to GitHub in the coming weeks, and you're welcome to open another PR there if you want.

Thanks!
content.html:
@Mohamd Ayman , I think this tutorial needs more work.

The user should be instructed from the beginning to start from the gzweb repository clone, otherwise the ../gz3d/build/gz3d.js doesn't lead anywhere. And if they're starting from the source, then they might as well use the example from there instead of creating a new file.

I also think that the code explanation could give the user a bit more context.

So I'll decline this pull request for now. We'll be migrating this repository to GitHub in the coming weeks, and you're welcome to open another PR there if you want.

Thanks!
